intro: Hsenhsua chrysea, commonly known as the golden flame orchid, is a striking tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow and orange flowers, which bloom in clusters along the stem. The plant has a slender, erect stem with broad, lance-shaped leaves that are dark green in color. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Hsenhsua chrysea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
